qas.question: The elections of which year caused new hostilities?
Who led a movement against the government in June of 1875?
Which orchestrator of the Revolution of the North was captured?
Guerra was assassinated in a suburb of which city?
With whom was he said to have conspired?

context: But the peace in the state did not last long, the elections of <a0_0>1875<a0_0/> caused new hostilities. <a1_0>Ángel Trías<a1_0/> led a new movement against the government in June 1875 and maintained control over the government until September 18, 1875 when <a2_0>Donato Guerra<a2_0/> the orchestrator of the Revolution of the North was captured. Donato Guerra was assassinated in a suburb of <a3_0>Chihuahua City<a3_0/> where he was incarcerated for conspiring with <a4_0>Ángel Trías<a4_0/>. During October 1875 several locations were controlled by rebel forces, but the government finally regained control on November 25, 1875.
